com.ffeichta.tictactoe.field

Class TicTacToe

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ffeichta.tictactoe.field.TicTacToe
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TicTacToeClient, TicTacToeServer

    public class TicTacToe
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the field of the game Tic Tac Toe. The size of the field can go from 3x3 up to 10x10. You can set a move into a field, find out if someone can still win ask the number of the winner. Player 1 has the number -1 and player 2 has the number -2.
    The field is a 2D-Array of type Integer. If the size is 3x3 the field looks as follows:
    0 1 2
    3 4 5
    6 7 8
    If player 1 sets a move to position 0 the result is
    -1 1 2
    3 4 5
    6 7 8
    Author:
    Fabian

    • Constructor Detail

      • TicTacToe

        public TicTacToe(int fieldSize)
        Initializes the field and fills it with values. If the size is too big or too small it sets it to a valid value
        Parameters:
        fieldSize -

    • Method Detail

      • getField

        public int getField(int row,
           int column)
        Finds out how the field is set on a certain position. Returns 0 if the position isn't set, -3 if row or column are too big or to small, PLAYER1 if player 1 already set this field or PLAYER2 if player 2 already set this field
        Parameters:
        row -
        column -
        Returns:

      • setMovePlayer1

        public int setMovePlayer1(int move)
        Sets the move of player 1. The return is 0 if it was successfully, -1 if the position is invalid and -2 if the move is already set
        Parameters:
        move -
        Returns:

      • setMovePlayer2

        public int setMovePlayer2(int move)
        Sets the move of player 2. The return is 0 if it was successfully, -1 if the position is invalid and -2 if the move is already set
        Parameters:
        move -
        Returns:

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner()
        Returns the winner of the game. The winner can be player 1 or player 2. If there is no winner the return is 0
        Returns:

      • someoneCanWin

        public boolean someoneCanWin()
        Returns true if someone can still win the game
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints the field. The numbers of the players are replaced with 'X' and 'O'. This method is only used for testing For example:
        01X
        3OX
        678
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
